_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Motor Vehicle Seating and Interior Trim Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Toyota Boshoku Indiana, LLC. (TBIN) personnel in the Princeton, Indiana take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment.  The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur, while providing systems that minimize the  of any release that does occur and contain it in as small as area as possible.





ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:  It is TBIN's policy to operate its plant in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  The facility has a detailed, practiced Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.





FACILITY DESCRIPTION:  The TBIN facility produces foam seat cushions for the automotive industry.  The foam process uses Toluene Diisocyanate (TDI) as a raw material.  The facility stores TDI in an 8,000-gallon storage tank.  The storage tank is surrounded by a secondary containment structure.





GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:  The facility has completed a detailed analysis on the process to ensure the safe use and operation of the applicable equipment.   Numerous safeguards are in place and include Operational Procedures, manual and automated control systems, safety interlocks, and other accepted good engineering and industry practices.  The facility uses both procedural as well as technological systems to ensure safe handling of TDI.





FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  The TBIN plant has not had an accident involving TDI that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases in the past 5 years.





EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:  In the event of an emergency involving TDI, plant personnel will notify the Princeton Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation.  We have provided the fire department with our Emergency Response Plan and m

embers of the fire department will inspect the plant.  In addition, TBIN has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to aid in the cleanup of a release.





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  TBIN has an ongoing and continuing process to update and review our manufacturing process for safety considerations.
